title: Roaring City (1951 Film-Noir) Pistol Point Suspense! Action-packed thrills

sources.title: Roaring City (1951 Film-Noir) Pistol Point Suspense! Action-packed thrills
sources.description:
Roaring City (Sisters in Crime) is a 1951 American crime film produced and directed by William Berke. It was distributed by the independent Lippert Pictures as a second feature intended for the cinema, as well as  for television (under the name Sisters in Crime).

Summary:
A San Francisco private eye finds himself under suspicion while investigating a prizefighter's murder.

Main Actors:
Hugh Beaumont - Dennis O'Brien
Edward Brophy - 'Professor' Frederick Simpson Schicker
Richard Travis - Inspector Bruger
Joan Valerie - Irma Rand
Wanda McKay - Sylvia Rand
Rebel Randall - Gail Chase
William Tannen - Ed Gannon
Greg McClure - Steve Belzig, alias Vic Lundy
Anthony Warde - Bill Rafferty
Abner Biberman - Eddie Paige
Stanley Price - Harry Barton


B&W version: https://youtu.be/9d9tMq3ANaE


00:00 Full movie (with subtitles)
05:21 Boat rental owner Dennis "Denny" O'Brien is drawn into a suspicious betting scheme by fight manager Harry Barton.
12:45 A doctor reveals that boxer Ham Harper risks his life in a rigged fight due to a dangerous blood clot.
20:10 In a shocking twist, Vic Lundy defies expectations and refuses to lose the match, creating chaos.
30:25 A threatening note uncovers Barton's deeper involvement in a conspiracy surrounding the boxing world.
40:02 After a violent confrontation, Denny finds himself framed for the murder of Steve Rand.
50:15 Confronting Bill Rafferty reveals his connection to Sylvia and a hidden fortune tied to the case.
56:00 Sylvia confesses her stepmother Irmaâ€™s crimes, leading to a dramatic resolution and justice served.


@CultCinemaClassics
